title: Tapan Acharya
text:
Tapan Acharya (born 2 August 1981) is an Indian actor, writer, producer and director, popular in <a href="Marathi%20people">Marathi</a> and <a href="Konkani">Konkani</a> Cinema. He is best known for the Konkani movies <a href="Martin%20%282017%20film%29">Martin (2017 film)</a>, and <a href="Aleesha%20%28film%29">Aleesha (film)</a>. He also worked as a state youth icon for the <a href="Election%20Commission%20of%20India">Election Commission of India</a> to increase voter awareness in <a href="Goa">Goa</a>. 
Personal.
Early life.
Tapan Acharya was born to a <a href="Goud%20Saraswat%20Brahmin">Goud Saraswat Brahmin</a> family in the small village of <a href="Loliem-Polem">Loliem-Polem</a> towards the southern boundary of the <a href="India">Indian</a> state of <a href="Goa">Goa</a>. He attended school in his village at Shri Damodar Vidhalaya, and attended higher education at Shri Damodar College of Commerce and Economics, <a href="Margao">Margao</a>, <a href="South%20Goa%20district">South Goa</a>. While pursuing a degree in law from G.R Kare Law College he also completed a <a href="postgraduate%20diploma">postgraduate diploma</a> in management studies. He is credited with having knowledge in <a href="astrology">astrology</a>, <a href="numerology">numerology</a>, <a href="Vedas">Vedas</a>, and <a href="mythology">mythology</a>. He holds various diplomas and certificates in <a href="gemology">gemology</a>, astrology & Vedic studies, as well.
Career.
Although early in life he wanted to be behind the camera, he was first thrust in to the public eye as host of TV show Chum Chum Chanana on <a href="Doordarshan">Doordarshan</a> Goa. He went on to star in his first film, <a href="Aleesha%20%28film%29">Aleesha (film)</a> in 2004, which was released at First IFFI in Goa, it was the well received, winning the National Award for Best Feature Film in the Regional Category.
